snippet: Peruvian officials said Greenpeace had refused to hand over the names of activists who placed a sign in a protected area near ancient etchings in the desert.
abstract: Peruvian officials say Greenpeace has refused to divulge names of activists who entered protected area near Nazca Lines; activists placed sign promoting renewable energy on ground, damaging fragile desert landscape.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and ANDREA ZARATE
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Caracas, and Andrea Zarate from Lima, Peru.

lead_paragraph: Peruvian officials said Greenpeace had refused to hand over the names of activists who placed a sign in a protected area near ancient etchings in the desert.

headline.main: Greenpeace Won’t Name Activists, Peru Says
headline.print_headline: Greenpeace Won’t Name Activists, Peru Says
